system.description: Reduce penalties for using two weapons. When wielding two single-handed weapons, the character reduces the penalty for attacks with both weapons by 10 (to -10 for the primary hand and -20 for the secondary hand).
The character suffers no penalties for fighting in melee combat due to obscured vision, darkness, fog, smoke, or similar conditions.
Reduce effective falling distance by a number of metres equal to the character's Agility bonus. Also gain +20 to Acrobatics tests when using the Jump special use.
Once per day, the character can re-roll a failed test to gather information from a group of people.
When suffering Fatigue from Blood Loss, the character may make a Challenging (+0) Willpower test to ignore the Fatigue for that round.
As a Full Action, the character may make an Opposed Weapon Skill test against an opponent to force them to drop their weapon. With 3 or more Degrees of Success, the character can take the weapon.
When ganging up on an opponent, the character gains an additional +10 bonus to Weapon Skill tests for outnumbering. If both characters have this talent, the total bonus is +20.
-10 to Fellowship and Influence tests when dealing with Chaos Cults. This talent does not cost XP.
-10 to Fellowship and Influence tests when dealing with Mutants. This talent does not cost XP.
-10 to Fellowship and Influence tests when dealing with Recidivists. This talent does not cost XP.
-10 to Fellowship and Influence tests when dealing with Xenos. This talent does not cost XP.
-10 to Fellowship and Influence tests when dealing with The Mechanicum. This talent does not cost XP.
-10 to Fellowship and Influence tests when dealing with the Ecclesiarchy. This talent does not cost XP.
The character can summon metal objects weighing up to 2 kg per point of Willpower bonus from up to 40 metres away to their hand.

Spend one round psyching up to enter a frenzied state. While Frenzied, gain +10 to Weapon Skill, Strength, Toughness, and Willpower, but suffer -20 to Ballistic Skill, Intelligence, and Fellowship. Must attack the nearest enemy in melee. Immune to Fear, Pinning, Stunning, and Fatigue effects. Cannot Parry, retreat, or flee. Cannot use psychic powers.
When Stunned, the character may make a Challenging (+0) Toughness test to ignore the effects of being Stunned.

Mundane horrors, such as mutilated corpses or grisly crime scenes, do not cause Insanity points or Fear tests. Daemons, Warp phenomena, and other unnatural horrors still affect the character normally.
The character may retry a failed Awareness test once, but with a -10 modifier.
The character can stand from prone as a Free Action.
When making a ranged attack, the character may add the Degrees of Success from the attack roll to reduce the Armour value of any cover protecting the target.
+10 to Fellowship tests when dealing with the Administratum, and +5 to Influence tests involving them.
+10 to Fellowship tests when dealing with the Adeptus Arbites, and +5 to Influence tests involving them.
+10 to Fellowship tests when dealing with the Adeptus Mechanicus, and +5 to Influence tests involving them.
+10 to Fellowship tests when dealing with Astropaths, and +5 to Influence tests involving them.
+10 to Fellowship tests when dealing with the Ecclesiarchy, and +5 to Influence tests involving them.
+10 to Fellowship tests when dealing with the Imperial Guard, and +5 to Influence tests involving them.
+10 to Fellowship tests when dealing with the Imperial Navy, and +5 to Influence tests involving them.
+10 to Fellowship tests when dealing with the Inquisition, and +5 to Influence tests involving them.
+10 to Fellowship tests when dealing with Nobility, and +5 to Influence tests involving them.
+10 to Fellowship tests when dealing with the Underworld, and +5 to Influence tests involving them.
The character can draw a weapon as a Free Action.
The character halves all reload times, rounded down, to a minimum of a Half Action.
+10 bonus to tests to resist the effects of Cold.
+10 bonus to tests to resist the effects of Fear.
+10 bonus to tests to resist the effects of Heat.
+10 bonus to tests to resist the effects of Poisons.
+10 bonus to tests to resist the effects of Psychic Powers.
+10 bonus to tests to resist the effects of Radiation.
Gain an additional wound. This talent may be taken multiple times, each time gaining another wound.

As a Full Action, the character may make a special melee attack to stun an opponent. If the attack hits, it deals no damage but the target must make a Challenging (+0) Toughness test or be Stunned for 1 round and knocked Prone.
The character can un-jam a ranged weapon as a Half Action rather than a Full Action.
The character can make a Psyniscience test as a Free Action instead of a Half Action.
The character can increase the potency of advanced weaponry through ritual maintenance and tech-prayers.
The character can use Bolt weapons without penalty.
The character can use Chain weapons without penalty.
The character can use Flame weapons without penalty.
The character can use Heavy weapons without penalty.
The character can use Las weapons without penalty.
The character can use Launcher weapons without penalty.
The character can use Low-Tech weapons without penalty.
The character can use Melta weapons without penalty.
The character can use Plasma weapons without penalty.
The character can use Power weapons without penalty.
The character can use Shock weapons without penalty.
The character can use Solid Projectile weapons without penalty.
The character gains extra Armour Points equal to their Intelligence bonus, which may be distributed across any armoured locations. This requires one hour of work and access to an armourer's workshop.
The character can Parry while Frenzied. Additionally, the character may re-roll a failed test to snap out of or resist Frenzy.
The character can fire Heavy weapons on Semi-Auto or Full Auto without bracing first. They also gain +20 to Athletics tests when using the Heft special use.
Opponents fighting the character in melee gain no bonus for Ganging Up against the character.
The character uses Intelligence instead of Agility for Initiative rolls, and rolls two dice picking the highest.
The character uses Perception instead of Agility for Initiative rolls, and rolls two dice picking the highest.
The character may use Fellowship instead of Influence for Requisition tests, representing personal connections rather than formal authority.
+10 to Interrogation tests. Additionally, gain +5 for each ally assisting who also has this talent.
system.prerequisites: Clues from the Crowds, S 40 or WP 40

system.description: Once per turn, after a successful Parry, the character may make a Standard Attack against the attacker as a Free Action with a -20 penalty to Weapon Skill.
The character may reduce their Influence to increase Subtlety, trading 1 point of Influence for 1d5 Subtlety.
The character may use Willpower in place of Agility when making Evasion tests against psychic attacks.
Once per turn, if the character succeeds on an All Out Attack, they may immediately make a second All Out Attack against the same target as a Free Action.
When firing two ranged weapons at the same target, the second attack gains a +20 bonus if the first attack hit.
The character can use a Needle Pistol without penalty.
The character can use a Needle Rifle without penalty.
The character can use a Web Pistol without penalty.
The character can use a Webber without penalty.
The character may use Fellowship instead of Agility when making Shadowing tests in crowds.
Whenever the character is Charging or Running, ranged attacks targeting them suffer a -20 penalty to Ballistic Skill tests.
The character always heals as if Lightly Damaged, regardless of the actual level of damage.
+10 to Weapon Skill tests against Chaos Space Marines. The character must pass a Willpower test to retreat from or surrender to them.
+10 to Weapon Skill tests against Daemons. The character must pass a Willpower test to retreat from or surrender to them.
+10 to Weapon Skill tests against Mutants. The character must pass a Willpower test to retreat from or surrender to them.
+10 to Weapon Skill tests against Psykers. The character must pass a Willpower test to retreat from or surrender to them.
+10 to Weapon Skill tests against Xenos. The character must pass a Willpower test to retreat from or surrender to them.
+10 to Weapon Skill tests against Heretics. The character must pass a Willpower test to retreat from or surrender to them.
As a Full Action, the character may move up to their Full Move rate and make a single ranged attack at any point during the move.
When firing two ranged weapons, the targets do not need to be within 10 metres of each other.
When making a ranged attack, the character imposes a penalty on the target's Evasion test equal to 10 times the Degrees of Success on the attack roll.
When making a melee attack, the character imposes a penalty on the target's Evasion test equal to 10 times the Degrees of Success on the attack roll.
The character may spend a Fate point to make melee attacks unavoidable for one round. The target cannot use Evasion reactions against the character's melee attacks.
The character can discharge stored electrical energy as a melee attack using Luminen Capacitors.
The character can hover for extended periods using Maglev Coils, gaining greater mobility and flight duration.
The character suffers no penalties for firing at long or extreme range.
The character gains the ability to use Weapon mechadendrites.
The character gains the ability to use Utility mechadendrites.
The character suffers no penalty when making Called Shot attacks with ranged weapons.
The character suffers no penalty when making Called Shot attacks with melee weapons.
Once per day, the character may make a Tech-Use test to heal 1d5 damage using their Autosanguine implants.
The character may re-roll failed Willpower tests to resist psychic powers.
As a Full Action, the character may make multiple melee attacks with a single Weapon Skill test.
The character can fight with a melee weapon in each hand. They can make attacks with both weapons in the same turn.
The character can fight with a ranged weapon in each hand. They can make attacks with both weapons in the same turn.
The character's unarmed attacks count as Deadly Natural Weapons, and the character may re-roll damage for unarmed attacks.
The character may spend a Fate point to add 1d5 to their psy rating for a single power use.
As a Full Action, the character may make one melee attack against each opponent currently engaged with them in melee.
The character subtracts their Willpower bonus from the Degrees of Failure on any failed Fear or Pinning test. If this reduces the result to 0 or less, it counts as 1 Degree of Success instead.
After making a melee attack, the character may make a Challenging (+0) Acrobatics test to move at half rate as a Free Action. This may be done once per round and does not provoke free attacks.
The character adds 5 times their psy rating to any Opposed test when defending against psychic powers.
Once per round, the character may re-roll one missed melee attack made with a bladed weapon.
The character adds half their Weapon Skill bonus (rounded up) to melee damage.
When the character inflicts Critical damage with a ranged attack, they add their Perception bonus to the Critical damage result.
When the character inflicts Critical damage with a melee attack, they add their Perception bonus to the Critical damage result.
Reduce Subtlety loss from interrogation by 1d5. If the result would be negative, gain that amount of Subtlety instead.
The character may spend a Fate point before making a ranged Standard Attack. If the attack hits, add the Degrees of Success to both the damage and the penetration of the attack.
Whenever the character triggers Psychic Phenomena (but not Perils of the Warp), they may roll twice on the Psychic Phenomena table and choose which result to apply.
The character may spend a Fate point to reveal a clue or important piece of information during an investigation.
Social and Leadership skills affect NPCs within 100 times the character's Fellowship bonus in metres, instead of the normal 10 times.

When the character uses the All Out Attack action to make a single melee attack, they add half their Strength bonus (rounded up) to the weapon's penetration. The attack also gains the Concussive (2) quality.
All Common Lore and Scholastic Lore skills count as Known (rank 1) for the character. Additionally, gain +1 Degree of Success on any successful Lore test.
As a Full Action, the character may make many melee attacks with a single Weapon Skill test, gaining additional hits for additional Degrees of Success.
The character can discharge stored electrical energy as a ranged attack using Luminen Capacitors.
system.prerequisites: Luminen Shock, Luminen Capacitors, Mechanicus Implants

system.description: The character may spend a Fate point to automatically succeed on a test with the selected skill, with a number of Degrees of Success equal to their characteristic bonus.
The character adds half their Ballistic Skill bonus (rounded up) to ranged damage.
The character may spend a Fate point to ignore all penalties from Critical damage for one round.
The character doubles their speed when Charging.
The character moves more quickly in combat. Full Move becomes Agility bonus x 3, and Run becomes Agility bonus x 6.
The character may make one additional Dodge or Parry attempt per round beyond the normal one reaction.
The character gains +20 to Medicae tests and enhanced First Aid capabilities.
The character can shoot into melee combat without penalty and never accidentally hits allies.
The character can break enemies with an armoured charge, inflicting devastating impact damage when charging.
The character reduces all Critical damage taken by their Toughness bonus, to a minimum of 1.
The character suffers no penalties when fighting with two single-handed weapons.
system.prerequisites: Ag 45, Ambidextrous, BS 40 or WS 40, Two-Weapon Wielder (Melee), Two-Weapon Wielder (Ranged)

system.description: Once per session, the character may ignore a single Psychic Phenomenon result they have generated.
